snippet: Blasts at a gas station east of the capital and in a suburb came as the United Nations said more than 60,000 people had been killed in Syria’s 22-month conflict.
abstract: At least 30 people are killed in blast at gas station east of Damascus, Syria, in what appears to be government airstrike; violence comes as United Nations releases study showing that more than 60,000 people have been killed in Syria’s 22-month conflict and as family of James Foley, reporter for Agence France-Presse, announces he has been kidnapped in northwest Syria.
lead_paragraph: Blasts at a gas station east of the capital and in a suburb came as the United Nations said more than 60,000 people had been killed in Syria’s 22-month conflict.

headline.seo: Dozens of Syrians Killed in Explosions Around Damascus
headline.main: Syrians Killed in Gas Line; U.N. Raises War’s Casualty Figures
headline.print_headline: Syrians Killed in Gas Line; U.N. Raises War’s Casualty Figures
